One of these scenarios is to represent that an Endpoint has both 'LAN' and protocol-specific aspects. For example, an Endpoint could be both a LANEndpoint as well as a DHCPEndpoint.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Key
QUALIFIER.VALUE: true

QUALIFIER.NAME: Override
QUALIFIER.VALUE: SystemElement

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: SystemElement represents one aspect of the Endpoint.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Key
QUALIFIER.VALUE: true

QUALIFIER.NAME: Override
QUALIFIER.VALUE: SameElement

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: SameElement represents an alternate aspect of the Endpoint.

QUALIFIER.NAME: ASSOCIATION
QUALIFIER.VALUE: true

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: CIM_EndpointIdentity indicates that two ProtocolEndpoints represent different aspects of the same underlying address or protocol-specific ID. This association refines the CIM_LogicalIdentity superclass by restricting it to the Endpoint level and defining its use in well understood scenarios. One of these scenarios is to represent that an Endpoint has both 'LAN' and protocol-specific aspects. For example, an Endpoint could be both a LANEndpoint as well as a DHCPEndpoint.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Key
QUALIFIER.VALUE: true

QUALIFIER.NAME: Override
QUALIFIER.VALUE: SystemElement

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: SystemElement represents one aspect of the Endpoint.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Key
QUALIFIER.VALUE: true

QUALIFIER.NAME: Override
QUALIFIER.VALUE: SameElement

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: SameElement represents an alternate aspect of the Endpoint.

QUALIFIER.NAME: ASSOCIATION
QUALIFIER.VALUE: true

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: ElementSettingData represents the association between ManagedElements and applicable setting data. This association also describes whether this is a default or current setting.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Key
QUALIFIER.VALUE: true

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The managed element.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Key
QUALIFIER.VALUE: true

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The SettingData object associated with the element.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An enumerated integer indicating that the referenced setting is a default setting for the element, or that this information is unknown.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An enumerated integer indicating that the referenced setting is currently being used in the operation of the element, or that this information is unknown.

QUALIFIER.NAME: ASSOCIATION
QUALIFIER.VALUE: true

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: ElementSettingData represents the association between ManagedElements and applicable setting data. This association also describes whether this is a default or current setting.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Key
QUALIFIER.VALUE: true

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The managed element.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Key
QUALIFIER.VALUE: true

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The SettingData object associated with the element.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An enumerated integer indicating that the referenced setting is a default setting for the element, or that this information is unknown.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An enumerated integer indicating that the referenced setting is currently being used in the operation of the element, or that this information is unknown.

QUALIFIER.NAME: ASSOCIATION
QUALIFIER.VALUE: true

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: ElementSettingData represents the association between ManagedElements and applicable setting data. This association also describes whether this is a default or current setting.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Key
QUALIFIER.VALUE: true

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The managed element.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Key
QUALIFIER.VALUE: true

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The SettingData object associated with the element.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An enumerated integer indicating that the referenced setting is a default setting for the element, or that this information is unknown.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An enumerated integer indicating that the referenced setting is currently being used in the operation of the element, or that this information is unknown.

QUALIFIER.NAME: ASSOCIATION
QUALIFIER.VALUE: true

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association makes explicit the dependency of a SAP or ProtocolEndpoint on an underlying LANEndpoint, on the same system.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Key
QUALIFIER.VALUE: true

QUALIFIER.NAME: Override
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Antecedent

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The underlying LANEndpoint, which is depended upon.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Key
QUALIFIER.VALUE: true

QUALIFIER.NAME: Override
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Dependent

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The AccessPoint or ProtocolEndpoint dependent on the LANEndpoint.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This describes the framing method for the upper layer SAP or Endpoint that is bound to the LANEndpoint. Note: "Raw802.3" is only known to be used with the IPX protocol.

QUALIFIER.NAME: ASSOCIATION
QUALIFIER.VALUE: true

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: ElementSettingData represents the association between ManagedElements and applicable setting data. This association also describes whether this is a default or current setting.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Key
QUALIFIER.VALUE: true

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The managed element.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Key
QUALIFIER.VALUE: true

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The SettingData object associated with the element.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An enumerated integer indicating that the referenced setting is a default setting for the element, or that this information is unknown.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An enumerated integer indicating that the referenced setting is currently being used in the operation of the element, or that this information is unknown.
